about_the_game:
Step into the shoes of 'new_user', an engineer tasked with the monumental challenge of repairing machines to escape from an unknown location. Your tool? The fundamental building blocks of digital logic: complementary transistors.

BUILD YOUR OWN PARTS

Begin with the basics of electronic components, creating gates out of complementary transistors. Learn the art of electronic design as you progress from simple NAND and NOR gates to complex circuits capable of performing intricate tasks.

ASSEMBLE THEM

Combine your gates into larger, more sophisticated parts. Each assembly is a puzzle, demanding not just intelligence but creativity, planning, and foresight.

OPTIMIZE

Optimize your designs for efficiency and space, pushing the limits of your engineering prowess.

TERMINALS

All electronics seem non-functional, and they are your only way forward.

FIND YOUR WAY OUT

Advance into a strange world.
detailed_description:
JOIN OUR DISCORD


EARLY ACCESS

Hard Chip is in its active development phase. While the core player experience is in place, the content is subject to change. You may encounter areas where fine-tuning is ongoing, and some features may evolve as we continue to improve the game. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us shape the final product, and we appreciate your understanding and support during this exciting phase of development!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 - x64
  • Processor: 4th Gen i3 / 1th Gen Ryzen3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1050 / Radeon 5500
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11 - x64
  • Processor: 8th Gen i7 / 3th Gen Ryzen7
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1080 / Radeon 5700
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 3 GB available space

short_description: Hard Chip is a 3D simulation/puzzle game about building processors focusing on realism. Explore the world of semiconductor chip design and delve into the intricacies of CPU logic, floor planning, and propagation delay.
